results.title: [Kill Bill] Vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Bender, Miramax Films, A Band Apart and Quentin Tarantino
results.brief_description: Volume two of The Bride’s (Uma Thurman) quest to exact revenge on those who prevented her from leaving the violent world of the hired killer. In “Kill Bill Vol. 1” The Bride is pregnant attending her wedding, when all are massacred and she is shot in the head leaving her in coma for four years. After recovering and killing the main perpetrators, she heads out in “Vol. 2” to find her mentor/ex-lover Bill (David Carradine) to kill him for ordering her assassination (and shooting her!). Fending off a few of his accomplices along the way, she battles these intense foes with the sword and anything else to hand. The Bride’s exceptional level of skill is not just hate-driven but substantiated in the teachings of a great master, Pai Mei (Gordon Liu). An homage to martial arts films from the East and West but still infused with the wit and humour of a Quentin Tarantino picture, “Kill Bill Vol. 2” is a classic revenge story with all of the requisite action sequences and fine storytelling. Cast includes Daryl Hannah, Michael Madsen, Michael Parks and Lucy Liu. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: [Kids' fun: a compilation of cartoon adventures]
results.creator_credit: Castle Films, Animafilm Studio and Romania Film
results.brief_description: A collection of Romanian and classic American animation. First up are four fun-filled Romanian cartoons designed for young children (Music and sound affects, no spoken words). The characters Michaela, Benny and Tommy are seen here having fun with all of their animal friends. Following is a collection of classic American cartoons made between the 1930’s and 1950’s including the first Heckle and Jeckle cartoon.

results.title: [John Robertson Duigan Collection]
results.brief_description:
The John Robertson Duigan Collection is a collection of silent 9.5mm home movies filmed by early aviator and engineer John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951). The collection includes a Pathé-Baby 9.5mm film camera and projector owned by Duigan. The home movies provide an insight into the everyday lives of John and his family in Victoria, including picnics, trips to the Grampians and Colac, family snapshots and aeroplanes of the late 1920s.

John Robertson Duigan (1882–1951) was an early aviator and engineer. With the assistance of his brother Reginald Duigan, John built the first Australian-made aircraft to successfully fly, in 1910 at their family’s sheep station, Spring Plains, in Mia Mia, Victoria. Inspired by a postcard sent from a friend in London featuring a photo of Wilbur Wright flying his Model A aeroplane, John successfully built, tested and flew his own biplane and was one of the pioneering aviators in Australia who paved the way for the adventurous pilots of the 1920s. In 1920, John donated his original biplane to the Industrial and Technological Museum in Melbourne (now Museums Victoria). John and Reginald were commemorated as ‘pioneer aviators’ on a 6 cent stamp issued by Australia Post in 1970.

This collection was donated to ACMI by Martin Hudson.
